result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Instigation of Animal Fights, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 951.08(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

miscConds.notes:
DNA surcharge not ordered.
Pay all other costs and surcharges by end of probation.  If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.

The Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge, this case predates the change in law.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No  contact with drug community.
No contact with the known coactor Dontrell Richardson.
No ownership of any animals for a period of five (5) years.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
The Court objects to expungement.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes:
Forthwith.  Huber privileges for treatment only.
*10/22/2015  release privileges granted for medical care/appointments, including doctor appointments and physical therapy.

cf

Defendant Anthony Alexander in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  T

Exhibit #1 was offered and received by the state for purposes of sentencing.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 42 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 5 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 months.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
 
*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for treatment ONLY.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the known co-actor Dontrell Richardson.
*No ownership of any animals for a period of 5 years.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- The Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge, this case predates the change in law.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges by the end of probation. If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

The Court objects to expungement.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
filed.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Anthony Alexander in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  The state does not have all materials needed to proceed with sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Alexander in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Alexander in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Antoni J. Apollo for Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.    Filed, signed Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Alexander in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel is waiting for written offer and requests new scheduling confence.   Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Alexander in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mark Peterson-MPD Detective.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-23-2015 at 08:30 am.
